1_narrative.title: Narrative & Context
items: A session log was created to test the session logger functionality.
The session started at 2026-02-04 23:06 with the intent 'Testing the session logger'.
One test log entry was made at 23:07.
The session ended at 2026-02-04 23:08 and was marked as complete.

2_objectives.title: Objectives
items: Test the session logger.

3_success_criteria.title: Success Criteria
items: Session log created with start/end times, intent, and entries.
Session marked as complete.

4_decisions.title: Decisions & Rules
items: Use a structured log format with timestamps.
Include a 'Work Log' section for entries.
Include a 'Session Summary' section with metadata.

5_sops.title: SOPs / Workflows
items: Session logging procedure: Start session with timestamp and intent, add timestamped entries to Work Log, end session with timestamp, generate Session Summary.

7_inputs_outputs.title: Inputs & Outputs
items: Input: Intent 'Testing the session logger'.
Output: A completed session log file with 1 log entry and a summary.

10_status.title: Status
items: Complete.

11_progress.title: Progress Markers
items: Session started (23:06).
Test entry logged (23:07).
Session ended (23:08).
Session summary generated.

14_entities.title: Entity Maps
items: Session Logger: The system being tested.
Session Log: The output document.
Work Log: Section containing timestamped entries.
Session Summary: Section containing metadata (Start, End, Intent, Log entries count, Status).

15_glossary.title: Glossary
items: Intent: The purpose of the session.
Log entries: The count of individual timestamped items in the Work Log.

19_meta.title: Meta-Observations
items: The log format is minimal and effective for basic session tracking.

20_assets.title: Reusable Assets
items: Session log template with sections: SESSION LOG header, Start/Intent/Status, Work Log with timestamped entries, Session Summary with metadata.

summary: A session logger was tested by creating a structured log file with a start time, intent, one test entry, an end time, and a summary, confirming the basic logging workflow functions.
